issues.title: Performance requirement uses vague term 'fast'
issues.description: The spec requires the system to be 'fast' without defining a measurable metric.

evidence.quote: This system must perform well and be fast.

issues.impact: Cannot verify the requirement in any test.
issues.recommendation: Replace 'fast' with a specific latency target, e.g. 'P99 < 200 ms'.

issues.title: Authentication requirement contradicts itself
issues.description: Requirement 2 states users must be authenticated but then allows unauthenticated access.

evidence.quote: Users must be authenticated. The system also allows unauthenticated access.

issues.impact: Implementers cannot determine which rule takes precedence.
issues.recommendation: Clarify the authentication policy and remove the contradiction.

issues.title: Response requirement uses imprecise term 'quickly'
issues.description: Requirement 1 says the system shall respond 'quickly' without defining a measurable latency.

evidence.quote: The system shall respond quickly to all requests.

issues.impact: Cannot write a passing performance test.

issues.title: Cache and database update ordering unspecified
issues.description: Requirement 3 says both cache and database shall be updated but does not define which happens first or atomicity guarantees.

evidence.quote: The cache shall be updated. The database shall also be updated.

issues.impact: Race conditions or partial updates could occur.
issues.recommendation: Define the update order and atomicity requirements.
